items.content_html: A React color picker using React hooks (useState, useRef) that lets users select a color and view its HEX, RGB, HSL, and HSV values. Styled with Tailwind CSS, it is lightweight, efficient, and easy to integrate into any React project.

items.content_html: jpd-express-error is a lightweight utility package designed to standardize error handling in Express microservices. It ensures consistent error responses, typed messages, and structured error propagation across your services.

items.content_html: Tom Select is a lightweight (~16kb gzipped) hybrid of a textbox and select box. Forked from selectize.js to provide a framework agnostic autocomplete widget with native-feeling keyboard navigation. Useful for tagging, contact lists, etc.
items.title: orchidjs/tom-select: Tom Select is a lightweight (~16kb gzipped) hybrid of a textbox and select box. Forked from selectize.js to provide a framework agnostic autocomplete widget with native-feeling keyboard navigation. Useful for tagging, contact lists, etc.

items.content_html: Nesty-Backend is a lightweight library that brings decorator-based routing and middleware support to Express.js, making your backend code cleaner and more structured
items.title: Asad-Ali-Developer/Nesty-Backend: Nesty-Backend is a lightweight library that brings decorator-based routing and middleware support to Express.js, making your backend code cleaner and more structured

items.content_html: What we created with Cloudflare Worker is a Serverless Function running on Cloudflare's edge network. It acts as a lightweight API proxy that processes requests from the React app, fetches data from the OMDb API, and returns the response. This approach enhances security by hiding the API key and improves performance.
items.title: Christopher-Totlyakov/OnlineMovieAPI: What we created with Cloudflare Worker is a Serverless Function running on Cloudflare's edge network. It acts as a lightweight API proxy that processes requests from the React app, fetches data from the OMDb API, and returns the response. This approach enhances security by hiding the API key and improves performance.
